title: Haloacetic acids - lowest boiling point and why

content.question: Which compound, chloroacetic acid or iodoacetic acid, most likely has the lower boiling point, and why?

choices.label: Chloroacetic acid, because the London dispersion forces among its molecules are weaker.
Chloroacetic acid, because the dipole-dipole forces among its molecules are weaker.
Iodoacetic acid, because the London dispersion forces among its molecules are stronger.
Iodoacetic acid, because the dipole-dipole forces among its molecules are stronger.

content.answer: Chloroacetic acid, because the London dispersion forces among its molecules are weaker.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
